videos.title: About A Badly Drawn Boy: The Story of The Hour Of Bewilderbeast - Official Trailer
videos.description:
A documentary film about the boy himself Damon Gough and his 2000 Mercury Music Prize winning debut album.  Damon talks about his musical upbringing and how he and Andy Votel founded the Twisted Nerve record label in Manchester in the late 1990’s. 

We hear of the influences Damon brought to the recording of ‘The Hour of Bewilderbeast’, the songwriting process, the stories behind the songs and the various musicians and producers. 

The film features exclusive new interviews with Damon and acoustic performances of songs from the album filmed in the Gough family print factory in Bolton and his home in Manchester. 

Andy Votel tells us about Twisted Nerve, how he designed the album’s iconic artwork, the influences behind its creation and his production work on ‘The Hour Of Bewilderbeast’.  

We hear fantastic anecdotes from Damon and director Garth Jennings about working with Dame Joan Collins on the music video for ‘Spitting In The Wind’ – and we see and hear lots more about Damon’s music videos before and from ‘The Hour Of Bewilderbeast’. 

Contributors to the film: Andy Votel, musicians Jane Weaver, Ian Smith (Alfie), Jimi Goodwin (Doves), Guy Garvey (Elbow) and Ghostpoet.  Damon’s big brother Simon Gough, producer and member of Mum & Dad Joe Robinson, Grammy award winning producer Ken Nelson, XL Recordings Richard Russell, film director Garth Jennings, journalist Luke Bainbridge, radio DJ Pete Mitchell, Mercury Music Prize 2000 judge Fleur Sarfaty, Square One Studios' Bob Little and Artist Joe Simpson.  

The film features previously unseen archive footage, photographs, animation and lots more.

Directed & Produced by The Mitcham Submarine
Edited by James Harman
Executive Producer Lesley Bleakley

Buy The Hour of Bewilderbeast here - http://x-l-r.co/THOTB

https://www.facebook.com/badlydrawnboyofficial
https://twitter.com/badly_drawn_boy
https://www.instagram.com/badlydrawnboyofficial
https://www.badlydrawnboy.co.uk

https://archive.beggars.com/
tags: The Story of the Hour of Bewilderbeast

videos.title: The Cult - Coming Down
videos.description: Coming Down was the second single released from the Cult’s eponymous sixth album in 1994 and features their back-to-basics approach to recording.

videos.title: Thee Hypnotics - Soul Trader
videos.description:
Released on Situation Two on the 25th September 1989, here's Thee Hypnotics second single for the Beggars Group of labels. 

They released three albums for Situation Two, soon to be made available again on vinyl in the 'Righteously Recharged' vinyl box set. This also includes their non-Beggars 'The Very Crystal Speed Machine' album and rare demos and session tracks. 

Out for Record Store Day 2018!

videos.title: Comet Gain - Hideaway
videos.description:
Comet Gain were signed to Wiiija Records where they released three singles and two albums. 

Taken from the 'Say Yes to International Socialism!', it was released on the 29th April 1996.

videos.title: Velocette - Spoiled Children
videos.description:
This was Velocette's  second single for Wiiija, 'Spoiled Children' which is also available on 1997's 'Fourfold Remedy' album.

Velocette formed when Comet Gain split in two.

videos.title: The Lurkers - Shadow (lyric video)
videos.description:
Shadow is a brand new lyric video created to celebrate the 40th Anniversary of The Lurkers' debut single. 

The Lurkers are releasing a 5 CD retrospective box set on July 28th 2017 via The Arkive: https://archive.beggars.com/lurkers5cd 

To celebrate the 40th anniversary of the release of The Lurkers debut single ‘Shadow’ (the first ever single on Beggars Banquet Records in 1977) a brand new lyric video has been created via Creative Commission (www.creative-commission.com).  The video was produced by Luis Hindman & animated by Sufiyaan Salam who say "the idea for the concept was inspired by the artwork for the single. The design introduced a tone and colour scheme which was built upon with fast paced energetic lyrics which correspond with the tempo of the song"

Pete Stride from The Lurkers described it as; "a slightly deranged lyric video… and that’s just fine.”

This is the album version of ‘Shadow’ recorded by Stride/Esso/Wall/Moore

http://godslonelymen.com
www.facebook.com/BeggarsArchive

@beggarsarchive

videos.title: Six. By Seven Documentary - The Dream Is Sweeter Than The Taste
videos.description:
’The Closer You Get' by Six.By Seven, out now on Beggars Arkive: http://smarturl.it/6x7tcyg

To coincide with the re-release of Six.By Seven’s seminal second album 'The Closer You Get' on February 17th 2017, Beggars Arkive commissioned director Alex Mannion-Jones to produce a documentary 'The Dream Is Sweeter Than The Taste'.

Despite their unique sound, their huge popularity in the music press, endless touring and the efforts of the label, the hype never quite broke through into mainstream success. However, Six. By Seven frontman Chris Olley has always kept the fanbase alive and developed his own ways to distribute music outside of the industry. 

The original line up who made 'The Closer You Get' reformed to play sell out shows in their hometown of Nottingham on March 4th and the Garage in London on March 11th 2017.

Directed, filmed & edited by Alex Mannion-Jones 
Produced by The Mitcham Submarine
Sound recordist for John Leckie - Fabian Prynn

http://www.sixbyseven.co.uk

https://www.facebook.com/sixbyseven

https://twitter.com/ChrisOlley1
tags: The Dream is Sweeter than the Taste

videos.title: Six. By Seven - The Dream Is Sweeter Than The Taste [Film Trailer]
videos.description:
’The Closer You Get' by Six. By Seven, out now on The Arkive: http://smarturl.it/6x7tcyg

To coincide with the re-release of Six.By Seven’s seminal second album 'The Closer You Get' on February 17th, The Arkive commissioned director Alex Mannion-Jones to produce a documentary 'The Dream Is Sweeter Than The Taste'. Despite their unique sound, their huge popularity in the music press, endless touring and the efforts of the label, the hype never quite broke through into mainstream success. However, Six. By Seven frontman Chris Olley has always kept the fanbase alive and developed his own ways to distribute music outside of the industry. 

The original line up who made 'The Closer You Get' reformed and played two sell out shows in their hometown of Nottingham on March 4th and the Garage in London on March 11th 2017.

Directed, filmed & edited by Alex Mannion-Jones 
Produced by The Mitcham Submarine
Sound recordist for John Leckie - Fabian Prynn

‘Eat Junk Become Junk’ live footage is from the ‘Closer’ documentary. 
Filmed in 2000 at Molinaire London by Bear Cat Productions for Mantra Recordings. Edited & directed by Duncan Buchanan, producer Matt Quinn & executive producer Tony Marshall

http://www.sixbyseven.co.uk/

https://www.facebook.com/sixbyseven

https://twitter.com/ChrisOlley1
tags: Greatest Hits of Six by Seven
The Dream is Sweeter than the Taste

videos.title: Pierce Turner - Wicklow Hills
videos.description:
Taken from Pierce Turner's debut album 'It's Only a Long Way Across', released in 1986. The album was produced by Philip Glass.

Pierce went on to record two more albums for Beggars Banquet.

You can find his official website here - http://www.pierceturner.com/
tags: It's Only a Long Way Across (album)

videos.title: The Fall - Lucifer over Lancashire
videos.description:
The b-side of the 'Mr Pharmacist' single, produced by John Leckie. Published by Crescendo Music. 

Video directed by Tim Riley (P) 1986 Beggars Banquet Records Ltd

videos.title: Six by Seven - IOU Love
videos.description:
IOU Love

Remake of Invasion Of The Body Snatchers. They got us up at about 5AM to have us sitting in a bus in East London waiting for nothing. At 11 O'clock we went to the nearest pub and got arse-holed. They finally used me at about 9 o'clock at night for two shots. One of me on a bed, for which my poor hands had to spend 2 hours in make up, and another covered in spunk in the basement. A load of old bollocks really. Oh yeah, MTV banned this one too for being too, er...creepy. The kid being born out of the pod in the basement was an actor off Grange Hill. Apparently Donald Sutherland liked it. I liked MASH too.


IOU LOVE

You are the atom that started life
You are the glue of the universe
Every thousand years I’ve learned to take a breath
You are cosmic and I love you
They brought down the stars
And shined them because of you
They painted the sky in blue
‘Cause you asked them to
And all the rewards of life
Are just simple truths
You are reasoning for sure
Oh I’ll never know the secrets of the world
I’ll never know, I’ll never learn them now

IOU love...

I remember when you covered the earth in sleep
The ebb and flow and touch of your kiss
There can’t be a better way
With my last breath I will call your name
Oh I’ll never know the secrets of the world
I’ll never know, I’ll never learn them now

IOU love...

videos.title: Six by Seven - New Year
videos.description:
New Year

This was made by our mate Dave Doubledrop. He made the Eat Junk Become Junk video which was the cheapest and best and most fun video we ever did. For this one the label gave him a decent budget and we just said: "Do whatever you want just so long as none of us have to be in it!" It's the best way to make a video. When we saw it we didn't even ask for any edits. MTV didn't like it because they didn't get the story...duh? What's to get? Girl walks around with a shopping trolley and a neck brace. Sounds like a perfectly reasonable music video to me.


NEW YEAR

Give me something I can live for
Give me something to believe in
Feed me saline, plasma life line
Skinned by sunlight, I’m hiding inside
I wanna reach out
And I wanna stay
How can I lose
If I refuse to fail

Broken pavements and bombed out buildings
Nothing left but mines for children
Right side numb and the left side is useless
Oh my world you really thrill me
I wanna reach out
And I wanna stay
How can I lose
If I refuse to fail

Into the new year

videos.title: Six by Seven - Candlelight
videos.description:
Candlelight

This was made in a basement in Spitalfields Market in East London and I still have no idea why? It could have been made anywhere for probably half the money but then that wouldn't have been quite as trendy I suppose. It was also very clever because they put strobes all over it which subsequently got it banned from MTV, the very channel they were making it for. Genius! MTV banned it because they said that when the strobes kicked in people watching it would be freaking out and having fits. We pleaded with MTV and told them that this was precisely the sort of fan we were trying to appeal to but they were having none of it. Are you perhaps having a fit now whist watching this? If so, write to YouTube not us.

CANDLELIGHT

Something broke like an egg in my throat
Something stopped beating blood in my chest
Forever gone, you are with me when I miss you
Candlelight give me time to get things right

Can you slow down?
Can you slow down now?
Slow down, slow down
Can you slow down now
My candlelight

I was counting clouds in a clear blue empty sky
I was skimming stones on a river the dam made dry
Is it fair, you are here when I am long gone?
Open your eyes, close the door and take what’s yours

Can you slow down?
Can you slow down now?
Slow down, slow down
Can you slow down now
My candlelight

We die a lot and live a little

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Desire
videos.description: From 1986's 'Discover' LP.

videos.title: Go Betweens - Streets of your Town
videos.description: Taken from the '16 Lovers Lane' album.

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Motion of Love
videos.description: From 1987's House of Dolls LP

videos.title: The Fall - Cruisers Creek
videos.description: Taken from 'This Nation's Saving Grace', released on Beggars Banquet in September 1985.

videos.title: The Fall - Victoria
videos.description: The Fall covered The Kinks 'Victoria' back in 1988, again taken from The Frenz Experiment. Enjoy.

videos.title: The Fall - Hit The North
videos.description: Released in 1988 and taken from 'The Frenz Experiment', here's the official 'Hit the North' video. Additional trivia question, how many parts did 'Hit the North' have?

videos.title: The Fall - Hey Luciani
videos.description:
Music for a play written by Mark E. Smith centred around the mysterious death of Pope John Paul I in 1978, and incorporating Israeli commandos, demonic possession, Italian fascists, ex-Nazis and a Scottish communist. Described by its author as "a cross between Shakespeare and The Prisoner," it starred Leigh Bowery and ran for two weeks in December 1986 at Riverside Studios, Hammersmith.
(Taken from http://www.dailyreckless.com/fall/archive/86.htm)

videos.title: Go Betweens - Right Here
videos.description: Taken from 1987's Tallulah album.

videos.title: Go Betweens - Bye Bye Pride
videos.description: From 1987's Tallulah album

videos.title: The Fall - There's a Ghost in My House
videos.description:
The Fall covered 'There's a Ghost in My House' on their excellent 1987 album The Frenz Experiment. 

Produced by Grant Cunliffe, Published by Jobete Music (UK) Ltd. Video directed by John Scarlett Davis, produced by Radar Films (P) 1987 Beggars Banquet Records Ltd
tags: There's A Ghost In My House

videos.title: The Fall - Couldn't Get Ahead
videos.description: Taken from VHS8489 - a live version of 'Couldn't Get Ahead' taken from 1985's This Nation's Saving Grace.

videos.title: The Fall - Mr Pharmacist
videos.description: 'Mr Pharmacist' is a cover, and gave The Fall their first Top 75 chart placing. Taken from the album 'Bend Sinister' in 1986, which was the third The Fall released with Beggars Banquet. This was also the first album by The Fall to be released on CD.

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Tangled Up In You
videos.description: 'Tangled Up in You' was released in December 1990 on the Beggars Banquet label, and was taken from Gene Loves Jezebel's album 'Kiss of Life' .

videos.title: The Early Years - All Ones and Zeros
videos.description: This was the first single from The Early Years self-titled debut album released in 2006 on Beggars Banquet.

videos.title: bis - Eurodisco
videos.description:
"Eurodisco" came from the second bis album, ‘Social Dancing’, which was released in March 1999.

‘Social Dancing’ was produced by Andy Gill (Gang Of Four).

videos.title: Stereolab - We're Not Adult Orientated
videos.description: 'We're Not Adult Orientated' is taken from Stereolab's 'The Groop Played Space Age Bachelor Pad Music', released in March 1993.

videos.title: PJ Harvey - Sheela-Na-Gig
videos.description:
'Sheela-Na-Gig' is PJ Harvey's second single, taken from her debut album 'Dry'.
The video was again filmed by Polly Harvey's friend Maria Mochnacz.

videos.title: PJ Harvey - Dress
videos.description: 'Dress' was PJ Harvey's debut single on the Too Pure label, taken from her debut album 'Dry'. The video is directed by Polly Harvey's friend Maria Mochnacz, her first video.

videos.title: Mouse on Mars - Cache Coeur Naif
videos.description: Taken from 1987's Autoditacker album released on Too Pure. It features vocals from Laetitia Sadier and Mary Hansen of Stereolab.

videos.title: Stereolab - Super-Electric
videos.description: Super-Electric was Stereolab's first single for Too Pure, released in September 1991. The track also featured on Too Pure's compilation 'Pop (Do We Not Like That)' and the Stereolab compilation 'Switched On'

videos.title: Mouse on Mars - Bib
videos.description: Taken from the 'Iaora Tahiti' album, it also features on the compilation 'Rost Pocks' on Too Pure.

videos.title: Stereolab - Low Fi
videos.description: Low Fi was released in September 1992 on Too Pure.

videos.title: Mouse on Mars - Schunkel
videos.description: Taken from 1995's Iaora Tahiti on Too Pure

videos.title: Buffalo Tom - Velvet Roof
videos.description:
Taken from 'Let Me Come Over', Velvet Roof also features on the 'Asides from (1988-1999)' album which Beggars Banquet released in 2000.

Subscribe to the Official Buffalo Tom YouTube channel here - https://www.youtube.com/user/OfficialBuffaloTom

videos.title: Main - Reformation
videos.description: When Loop disbanded in the 1990s, Robert Hampson formed Main. They released nine albums for Beggars Banquet and Situation Two.

videos.title: Radial Spangle - New Dress
videos.description: From 1994, taken from the Syrup Macrame album on Beggars Banquet

videos.title: Cornershop - Brimful of Asha (Norman Cook Remix)
videos.description: Brimful of Asha originally only made number 60 in the charts, until Norman Cook (aka Fatboy Slim) remixed the track. It was pressed in limited quantities, but popular demand led it to get a full release, which resulted in Cornershop's only Number One single back in 1998.

videos.title: The Dylans - Godlike
videos.description: Sheffield-based The Dylans formed in 1990 and released two albums, 'The Dylans' on Situation Two and 'Spirit Finger' on Beggars Banquet in 1991 and 1994.

videos.title: The Dylans - Mary Quant In Blue
videos.description: Sheffield-based The Dylans formed in 1990 and released two albums, 'The Dylans' on Situation Two and 'Spirit Finger' on Beggars Banquet in 1991 and 1994.

videos.title: Colin Newman - B
videos.description: Taken from 1980's 'A to Z' album

videos.title: Rubicon - Insatiable
videos.description: Insatiable featured on the 1995 Rubicon album 'Room 101' released by Beggars Banquet. Rubicon were an offshoot of Fields of the Nephilim.

videos.title: The Early Years - Say What I Want To
videos.description:
Released in February 2007, this was the lead track on The Early Years 'The Great Awakening EP'.

The Early Years signed to Beggars Banquet in 2006 and wasted no time in putting out two limited singles plus an outstanding self-titled debut album, which Drowned in Sound praised for its "noisy majesty", NME labelled "an explosion of unbridled sonic pleasure" and Artrocker decreed to be most definitely "the right side of prog."

videos.title: The Bubblemen - The Bubblemen Are Coming
videos.description: The Bubblemen were a Love and Rockets offshoot band who recorded just three songs (and I seem to remember some of this footage in the Yin & Yang video too) - released back in 1988, this features on the Love and Rockets DVD released back in 2003.

videos.title: The Darkside - High Rise Love
videos.description: The Darkside (also known as Darkside) were put together by former members of Spaceman 3 in 1989. They released two albums for Situation Two before splitting.

videos.title: Terminal Power Company - The Hunger The Heat
videos.description: Terminal Power Company were a Birmingham-based band who released two albums for Beggars Banquet and one for the Stay Free label. They formed in 1989 and split in 1995. 'The Hunger The Heat' is from 1992.
tags: Terminal Power Company The Hunger The Hunger

videos.title: Dick Dale - The Wedge Paradiso
videos.description: The legendary King Of the Surf Guitar with The Wedge Paradiso, taken from the Beggars Banquet album 'Calling Up Spirits' from 1996.

videos.title: Darkside - This Mystic Morning
videos.description: Taken from 1992's Melomania album

videos.title: The Ian Lowery Group - Need
videos.description: Released in August 1989 on Situation Two.

videos.title: Terminal Power Company - Salvation
videos.description: Terminal Power Company were a Birmingham-based band who released two albums for Beggars Banquet and one for the Stay Free label. They formed in 1989 and split in 1995. 'Salvation' is from 1992.

videos.title: 11:11 - Film School
videos.description: From 2005's self-titled album on Beggars Banquet

videos.title: Llama Farmers - Get The Keys And Go
videos.description: 'Get The Keys And Go' was released back in April 1999 and is taken from the Llama Farmers debut 'Dead Letter Chorus' released in June of that year. There's more Llama Farmers videos to come, and already I'm sensing a theme - the band only playing at the very end of the song... stay tuned.

videos.title: Oceansize - Catalyst
videos.description: Catalyst was released just before Oceansize's debut album 'Effloresce' - the album featured shimmering, delicate ambient keyboards and their trademark hypnotic, 3-guitar attack. All the tracks were recorded and produced by Chris Sheldon (Foo Fighters, Feeder) during Spring /Summer 2003.

videos.title: Llama Farmers - Snow White
videos.description: 'Snow White' was released in September 2000 and taken from the Llama Farmers second album 'El Toppo'.

videos.title: Lupine Howl - 125
videos.description: Lupine Howl are Sean Cook, Mike Mooney and Damon Reece - though this early single featured Jon Mattock. They released two albums for Beggars Banquet, this track '125' is taken from 'The Carnivorous Lunar Activities Of Lupine Howl' released in April 2001.

videos.title: Oceansize - New Pin
videos.description:
Oceansize released 'New Pin' on Beggars Banquet in March 2006.  Taken from the band's 'Everyone Into Position' album, 'New Pin' finds the band at their most melodic, all pulsating rhythms and deceptively angelic vocals.

All tracks were produced by Dan Austin (Doves, Cooper Temple Clause) and Oceansize and mixed by Danton Supple (Coldplay, Electric Soft Parade).

videos.title: Oceansize - Heaven Alive
videos.description:
Oceansize released their single 'Heaven Alive' on Monday the 15th of August 2005.  'Heaven Alive' is the first single from the band's second album, entitled 'Everyone Into Position', released later that year.

'Heaven Alive' was recorded at Monnow Valley studio in Monmouth and The Works studio in Stockport with Dan Austin (Doves, The Cooper Temple Clause, People In Planes) and mixed by Danton Supple (Coldplay, Doves) at Sarm Studios.  Featuring the band's trademark 3 guitar assault blended with radiant melodies 'Heaven Alive' finds Oceansize at their most confident yet.

videos.title: Oceansize - One Day All This Could Be Yours
videos.description: Oceansize released two albums on Beggars Banquet, and this track 'One Day All This Could Be Yours' is taken from 2003's 'Effloresce'.
tags: One Day All This Could Be Yours (Musical Recording)

videos.title: Llama Farmers - Yellow
videos.description: 'Yellow' was released in August 1999, and taken from the Llama Farmers' 'Dead Letter Chorus' album.

videos.title: Dream City Film Club - If I Die, I Die
videos.description: Taken from 1997's self-titled album, Dream City Film Club, the single 'If I Die, I Die'.

videos.title: Dream City Film Club - Pissboy
videos.description: Dream City Film Club were signed to Beggars Banquet for three albums, and featured the core members of Michael J Sheehy (who went on to release three solo albums for Beggars), Andrew Park and Laurence Ash. 'Pissboy' was released in May 1997 and is taken from their eponymous debut album.

videos.title: Bowery Electric - Freedom Fighter
videos.description: Lawrence Chandler and Martha Schwendener formed Bowery Electric in late 1993 - 'Freedom Fighter' is their single from 2000, taken fron the 'Lushlife' album.

videos.title: The Beekeepers - Lunar
videos.description:
The Beekeepers were Jamie East (vocals), Gary Thatcher (guitar), Mark Simpson (bass) and Steve 'Tree' Bailey (drums). I remember this video being shown on the much-missed Chart Show one indie chart Saturday morning - a top guitar song, I think you'll find. 'Lunar' came out in May 1997 and was again taken from the 'Third Party Fear and Theft' album.
I say 'were' but they have played live as recently as 2011 and they're active on Facebook and Twitter - head to https://www.facebook.com/thebeekeepers for more information

videos.title: The Beekeepers - Do You Behave Like That At Home?
videos.description: The Beekeepers were Jamie East (vocals), Gary Thatcher (guitar), Mark Simpson (bass) and Steve 'Tree' Bailey (drums). 'Do You Behave Like That At Home?' was released in February 1997 and was taken from their mini album 'Third Party Fear and Theft'. I say 'were' but they have played live as recently as 2011 and they're active on Facebook and Twitter - head to https://www.facebook.com/thebeekeepers for more information
tags: Do You Behave Like That At Home?

videos.title: The Beekeepers - Killer Cure
videos.description:
The Beekeepers were Jamie East (vocals), Gary Thatcher (guitar), Mark Simpson (bass) and Steve 'Tree' Bailey (drums). The track 'Killer Cure' was produced by Marco Pirroni from Adam and the Ants and was released in November 1997 - and endd up being the final single Beggars Banquet released by The Beekeepers. This video was directed by Tim Claxton.
I say 'were' but they have played live as recently as 2011 and they're active on Facebook and Twitter - head to https://www.facebook.com/thebeekeepers for more information

videos.title: Tindersticks - Sometimes It Hurts
videos.description: featuring vocals from the late Lhasa de Sala, 'Sometimes It Hurts' is directed by Martin Wallace and comes from the 'Waiting For The Moon' album. It also featured on the 'Bareback' DVD.

videos.title: Tindersticks - Can Our Love
videos.description: Directed by Martin Wallace, and also featuring on the 'Bareback' DVD is the 'Can Our Love' video - taken from the album of the same name.

videos.title: Whistler - Don't Jump In Front of My Train
videos.description: Whistler were signed to Wiiija between 1998 to 2000, and were a trio - Kerry Shaw, James Topham and former EMF and Apple Mosaic guitarist Ian Dench. They released two albums, 'Faith in the Morning' and the self-titled 'Whistler' of which this single released in February 1999 is taken.
tags: Don't Jump In Front Of My Train

videos.title: Mucho Macho - Rap is Really Changing
videos.description: Mucho Macho were on Wiiija and were Neil Dunford and Tim Punter. This track was on 1997's 'The Limehouse Link' album.

videos.title: Luna - Season Of The Witch
videos.description: 1996's Donovan cover from Luna - here's 'Season Of The Witch'

videos.title: Luna - Bobby Peru
videos.description: Taken from 1997's 'Pup Tent' album

videos.title: Luna - Lovedust
videos.description: 'Lovedust' is taken from the 'Romantica' album dating back to 2002. Britta Phillips became a full-time member of Luna replacing Justin Harwood.

videos.title: Sundial - Going Down
videos.description: Formed in 1990 by Gary Ramon, Sundial (also known as Sun Dial) released two albums for Beggars Banquet - both of which were reissued in 2007 and remastered. This is 1993's 'Going Down' single.

videos.title: Shady - Narcotic Candy
videos.description: David Baker left Mercury Rev after the 'Boces' album and recorded under the name 'Shady',  here's Narcotic Candy - and keep an eye out for his new project Variety Lights as well!

videos.title: Holy Barbarians - Space Junkie
videos.description: Ian Astbury left The Cult and formed Holy Barbarians with Patrick Sugg, Matt Garrett and Scott Garrett. They released just the one album 'Cream', plus the single 'Space Junkie', and here's the video. Enjoy!

videos.title: Stella US - The Word
videos.description: Released in 1997, Stella were fronted by Curt Perkins, and this is taken from their 'Ascension' album. A second album was recorded but never released until around 2008, and is now available via Bandcamp - http://curtperkins.bandcamp.com/album/american-weekend

videos.title: Carnival Art - Mr Blue Veins
videos.description: Carnival Art released two albums for Beggars Banquet between 1991 and 1993 - and also feature Brian Bell on bass - once Carnival Art split he switched to Weezer and as they say, the rest is history. Guitarist Ed was a former member of Jane's Addiction. There's lots of information over at Weezerpedia - http://www.weezerpedia.com/wiki/index.php?title=Carnival_Art

videos.title: Orchestre Jazira - Happy Day (Celebration)
videos.description: Orchestra Jazira were an Anglo-Ghanaian band who released two singles for Beggars Banquet in 1984. This is 'Happy Day (Celebration)'

videos.title: Pierce Turner - The Sky and the Ground
videos.description: Released on Beggars Banquet in 1989 and taken from the album of the same name, here's Pierce Turner's 'The Sky and the Ground'

videos.title: David J - I'll Be Your Chauffeur
videos.description: Reuniting David with his former Jazz Butcher colleagues, 'I'll Be Your Chauffeur' lights up Max Eider on lead guitar and an angelic Mr Jones plays Accordion, from the highly personal and often autobiographical album 'Songs From Another Season'.

videos.title: Daniel Ash - Walk This Way
videos.description: Latin America meets Midlands suburbia with belly dancing by Natacha Atlas. Video directed by Mitch Jenkins, single taken from the debut solo album 'Coming Down'.

videos.title: Daniel Ash - Get Out Of Control
videos.description: Mock rock performance from the second solo album 'Foolish Thing Desire'. Directed by Howard Greenhaigh.

videos.title: June - Stripteaser
videos.description:
June began in August of 1992 in Chapel Hill, NC, and ended around August of 1996. 

Beautiful close harmonies, intricate guitar lines and provocative structures; the puzzle pieces of the June sound. They built up tension through the intertwining vocals and guitars, gradually exploding in a burst of energy. The band signed with Beggars Banquet and released the album I Am Beautiful only to split shortly thereafter.
(slightly edited from http://www.squealermusic.com/catalog/june.html)

videos.title: Coco and the Bean - Killing Time
videos.description: Coco and the Bean signed to Mantra in 1995 and released one album 'Tales from the Mousehouse' and several singles and EP's.

videos.title: Coco and the Bean - Fair Play
videos.description: Coco and the Bean signed to Mantra in 1995 and released one album 'Tales from the Mousehouse' and several singles and EP's.

videos.title: The Delgados - Coming In From The Cold
videos.description: Taken from the 'Hate' album is the 'Coming In From The Cold' video from the wonderful Delgados, released on the Mantra Recordings label.
tags: Coming In From The Cold (Musical Recording)

videos.title: Sterling - Out Of The Sunlight
videos.description: Sterling were signed to Mantra Recordings. Out of the Sunlight was released in March 1997.

videos.title: The Drum - Horns Front
videos.description: China Drum changed their name to The Drum and released just the one album 'Diskin' - which featured this single 'Horns Front' released in 2000.

videos.title: Dot Allison - Strung Out
videos.description: Former One Dove singer Dot Allison released her second album 'We Are Science' on Mantra Recordings in 2002. This is the video for 'Strung Out' - enjoy!

videos.title: Grant McLennan - Easy Come Easy Go
videos.description: Taken from Grant McLennan's 'Watershed' album, released as a single in April 1991.

videos.title: Bauhaus - Ziggy Stardust
videos.description: Shot in August of 1982 beneath Camden Lock market in a series of complex tunnels, known locally as The Camden Catacombs. A mock gig complete with the entire back line in situ...Bauhaus does Bowie...gloriously. directed by Mick Calvert for Standard Pictures, from the October 1982 double A sided single.

videos.title: Bauhaus - Dancing
videos.description: Saxophone and Telecaster fusion - turbo charged. A Mask album highlight captured very live by Chris Collins at The Old Vic Theatre, February 1982 for Standard Pictures.

videos.title: Bauhaus - She's In Parties
videos.description: Shot in a disused warehouse in Wardour Street London, March 1983. Filmed by Howard Guard (who also directed the iconic Maxell tape advertisements), the end sequence of the band asleep in the back of the limousine was, according to Guard, very much for real. Finally wrapped up as dawn was breaking through. Poignant message with the scattered sleeves....single taken from the album Burning From The Inside.

videos.title: Bauhaus - God in an Alcove
videos.description: Tales of fallen idols turning into failing microphones here as Murphy, doing his best Iggy Pop, regains control by borrowing David's... Captured once again by Chris Collins for Standard Pictures, recorded very live at The Old Vic Theatre, February 1982. Two alternative studio versions are available on In The Flat Field Omnibus edition.

videos.title: Bauhaus - Hollow Hills
videos.description:
Peter Murphy daubed in day-glo paint enhanced by an ultra violet tube, simple theatrics used to dramatic effect.  
Filmed once again by Chris Collins at The Old Vic Theatre, audio available on Press The Eject And Give Me The Tape, studio version available on the album Mask.
tags: Hollow Hills (University Of London Union; 31 October 1980) (Musical Recording)

videos.title: Bauhaus - Kick in the Eye
videos.description: Frantic live version of this ever popular Bauhaus number shot by Chris Collins for Standard Pictures at The Old Vic Theatre, February 1982. Strobes, flashes and poses in abundance. Three studio versions cut, all available on the Omnibus edition of Mask.
tags: Kick In The Eye EP (Musical Album)

videos.title: Bauhaus - Mask
videos.description: Find yourself a derelict shoe factory and make good use of the readily available props. With more than a tip of the hat to the 1920's German expressionist filmmakers this is Bauhaus in sound and vision summed up and wrapped up perfectly in four and a half minutes. A classic piece of Bauhaus imagery, taken from the album of the same name and shot by Chris Collins and Ken Lawrence for Standard Pictures.

videos.title: Bauhaus - Stigmata Martyr
videos.description: More pose, more strobes in this awesome live rendition of one of In The Flat Field's more powerful numbers, this penultimate set closer reveals a tired and exhausted, but still fighting, vocalist. Future Tones On Tail Bass player Glenn Campling can also be spotted in this clip. Chris Collins once again in the directors chair- rolling the celluloid at The Old Vic Theatre, February 1982

videos.title: Bauhaus - In The Flat Field
videos.description: Captured at their live pinnacle and recorded at The Old Vic Theatre, London 24 February 1982 by Chris Collins for Standard Pictures. Audio of this ferocious live version is  available on Press The Eject And Give Me The Tape whilst the studio version can be found on the album of the same name.

videos.title: iLiKETRAiNS - The Deception
videos.description: 'The Deception' tells how proud determination and courageous spirit can fog the natural instinct of survival, with disastrous consequences. The tale is told through the eyes of an ill-fated round the world yachtsman. This video features a voiceover from '60s radio presenter and shipping forecaster Peter Jefferson. Released in 2007 on Beggars Banquet.

videos.title: iLiKETRAiNS - We Go Hunting
videos.description: iLiKETRAiNS brought back an historical tragedy through their inimitable, dramatic sound and style -'We Go Hunting' is an enormous charge of a song, its pace and immediacy powerfully conveying the chaos and paranoid hysteria experienced by the victims of The Salem Witch Trials in Massachusetts, where nineteen witches were accused, trialed and hung at the hands of Samuel Parris and the church in 1692. Released in 2008.

videos.title: iLiKETRAiNS - Spencer Perceval
videos.description: iLiKETRAiNS welcomed in 2007 with a spectacular nine and half minute release, reciting the story of the only successful assassination of a British Prime Minister, 'Spencer Perceval,' in 1812. The song is written from the perspective of murderer John Bellingham with the accompanying track, 'I am Murdered,' being sung from that of Spencer himself. Both tracks were produced by the band late 2006 in the first recording session for their debut album.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - Mirror People '88
videos.description:
A re-recorded single of the track from the third album, Earth.Sun.Moon. 

There's a great CD box set available from amazon.co.uk of the first four albums and bonus tracks - out now

videos.title: Love and Rockets - Motorcycle
videos.description:
A subject close to Daniel Ash's heart!. 

There's a great CD box set available from amazon.co.uk of the first four albums and bonus tracks.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - If There's A Heaven Above
videos.description: The opening track from the debut album, 'Seventh Dream Of Teenage Heaven'.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - So Alive
videos.description:
The band's big commercial crossover hit, from the album 'Love And Rockets. 

There's a great CD box set available which includes the first four albums and bonus tracks.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - No New Tale To Tell
videos.description:
The college hit that opened up a new audience in the USA for the band. From the album Earth.Sun.Moon. 

There's a great CD box set available from amazon.co.uk of the first four albums and bonus tracks.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - Ball Of Confusion
videos.description:
The debut single from 1985. A rocking cover of The Temptations' hit which wasn't originally on the UK album, Seventh Dream Of Teenage Heaven, though it's on all the reissues! 

There's a great CD box set available from amazon.co.uk of the first four albums and bonus tracks.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - The Light
videos.description:
The darker sound of Love And Rockets, from their third album, Earth.Sun.Moon. 

There's a great CD box set available from amazon.co.uk of the first four albums and bonus tracks.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - Yin and Yang (The Flowerpot Man)
videos.description: It's 1986 and all of a sudden these ex-Bauhaus types appear on The Chart Show complete with a fabulous video which makes those of us who didn't keep up suddenly realise that we should have - 'Yin and Yang (The Flowerpot Man)' is taken from the Express album and brightened up many lives back in the Autumn of 1986. Enjoy.

videos.title: Love and Rockets - No Big Deal
videos.description: No Big Deal is a remixed single version, taken from the album 'Love And Rockets'.

videos.title: King Blank - Uptight
videos.description: The Folk Devils split, and Ian Lowery signed to Situation Two for some collaborative projects - the first of which were King Blank. They released three singles and one album for the label in 1988 and this is the third single, 'Uptight'

videos.title: Goat - Everybody Wants to be There
videos.description: Released in 1991 on the Beggars Banquet label, they released five singles for Beggars, including one on the Situation Two label.

videos.title: Dead Fly Buchowski - Russian Doll
videos.description:
Released in 2004 on the Beggars Banquet label, 'Russian Doll' is the second single taken from Dead Fly Buchowski's debut album 'Land of the Rough' and is a take-no-prisoners power fuelled slab of perfect fuzz and psychedelic fused rock 'n' roll.  

'Russian Doll' busts in with an audio riot of primal pounding drum beats, a thumping bass line and a guitar riff so electrifying it penetrates to the pit of your stomach. Then the growling vocal kicks in, over-flowing with conviction and passion. It's a piece of perfectly frenzied riff ridden guitar rock.

videos.title: Goat - Good Times
videos.description: Released in 1991 on the Beggars Banquet label, they released five singles for Beggars, including one on the Situation Two label.

videos.title: Thee Hypnotics - Floatin' in my Hoodoo Dream
videos.description: Released October 1990 on the Situation Two label

videos.title: Thee Hypnotics - Shakedown
videos.description: September 1991 and Thee Hypnotics moved to Beggars Banquet, and released this single 'Shakedown'

videos.title: Thee Hypnotics - Justice In Freedom
videos.description:
Released March 1989 on the Situation Two label.

Director: WIZ and Max Abbiss-Biro
Producer: Richard Undrell, Sarah Baylis
DoP: Chris Middleton
Editor: Duncan Shepard

videos.title: Thee Hypnotics - Half Man Half Boy
videos.description: Released in April 1990 on Situation Two

videos.title: Loop - Arc-Lite
videos.description: Loop have reformed! This makes us excited! For more information head here - http://www.soundheads.org

videos.title: Loop - From Centre To Wave
videos.description: Loop have reformed - this makes us excited! A Gilded Eternity is set to be reissued on August 19th on vinyl this year - for more information head here - http://www.soundheads.org

videos.title: The Nefilim - Penetration
videos.description: The Nefilim were a Carl McCoy project, forming after Fields of the Nephilim split.

videos.title: South - Keep Close
videos.description: Taken from 2000's fantastic 'From Here On In' album, released on the MoWax label.

videos.title: Skelf - Eperiment
videos.description: Skelf is Howie B - his minimal electronic project on MoWax from the 'Comin At Ya' EP

videos.title: Mercury Rev - Bronx Cheer
videos.description: Taken from the 'Boces' album from 1993, the single 'Bronx Cheer'

videos.title: Mercury Rev - Something For Joey
videos.description: 'Something For Joey' taken from the 'Boces' album and released back in 1993 and features Ron Jeremy. You know what to expect...

videos.title: Red Lorry Yellow Lorry - Nothing Wrong
videos.description: Released in March 1988, Nothing Wrong is taken from the album of the same name released on Situation Two.

videos.title: Red Lorry Yellow Lorry - Temptation
videos.description: Temptation was released in 1989 and comes from the 'Blow' album released on Situation Two.

videos.title: John Rocca - Once Upon A Time
videos.description: Released in August 1984, this is John Rocca (formerly of Freeez)'s second solo single for Beggars Banquet.

videos.title: Luxuria - The Beast Box Is Dreaming
videos.description: Taken from 1990's 'Beast Box' album.

videos.title: Liberty 37 - Oh River
videos.description: Liberty 37 came from Swansea, Beggars Banquet released their first album 'The Greatest Gift' in 1999, from which this single was taken. They were great live!

videos.title: Liberty 37 - When We Say
videos.description: 'When We Say' was a live favourite whenever Liberty 37 played - and was released as a single in September 1999 on Beggars Banquet. Taken from 'The Greatest Gift' album.

videos.title: Luxuria - Redneck
videos.description: The debut single from Luxuria, released in 1987. Luxuria were Howard Devoto and Noko - who released two albums for Beggars Banquet.

videos.title: John Rocca - I Want It To Be Real
videos.description: 1984's single from John Rocca from Freeez. He released three solo singles on Beggars Banquet, this being the first.
tags: I Want it to be Real

videos.title: Bim Sherman - Bewildered
videos.description: Bim Sherman released three solo albums on Mantra Recordings - this is taken from 1996's 'Miracle' - from Wikipedia "Towards the end of his life, Bim Sherman took a whole new musical direction. He went to India and re-recorded his classic 70s roots tunes alongside a full Indian classical orchestra in Bombay, creating his masterpiece LP, the highly acclaimed Miracle. "

videos.title: Groop Dogdrill - Lovely Skin
videos.description: Groop Dogdrill released two albums on the Mantra Recordings label in 1998 and 2000. Hailing from Doncaster the trio also recorded several singles for the label. This track 'Lovely Skin' was taken from their 'Half Nelson' album.

videos.title: The Mighty Wah - Come Back
videos.description: The Mighty Wah! signed to Beggars Banquet and had a Top 20 hit with 'Come Back' - also chosen by John Peel as his single of the year. Taken from the album 'A Word To The Wise Guy' released in 1984.
tags: A Word To The Wise Guy
Come Back (The Story Of The Reds)

videos.title: China Drum - Somewhere Else
videos.description:
China Drum's sixth single for Mantra Recordings, taken from their excellent 'Self Made Maniac' album.

This was released on the 15th September 1997.

videos.title: China Drum - Fall Into Place
videos.description: Northumberland punks at their finest - Adam Lee who drums AND sings (although later on former Compulsion drummer Jan Alkema joined the band) and the brothers McQueen (Bill and Dave) and their first single for the Mantra Recordings label - taken from their debut album 'Goosefair', released in 1996.

videos.title: China Drum - Can't Stop These Things
videos.description: 'Can't Stop These Things' was released in 1996 on the Mantra Recordings label and is taken from the 'Goosefair' album. Adam is still a singing drummer at this point (something to be admired too)!

videos.title: Gorky's Zygotic Mynci - Stood On Gold
videos.description: Featuring lead vocals from Richard James, and taken from 'How I Long To Feel That Summer In My Heart' released back in 2001 on Mantra, have some Gorky's loveliness.

videos.title: China Drum - Wipe Out
videos.description:
'Wipe Out' was on the 'Stop it all Adding Up' single released by China Drum on Mantra Recordings in May 1998. 

China Drum are still going strong - you can find them over here - http://www.chinadrum.co.uk/

videos.title: China Drum - Fiction Of Life
videos.description: 'Fiction Of Life' was released back in 1997 and comes from the 'Self Made Maniac' album released on Mantra Recordings

videos.title: Gorky's Zygotic Mynci - Poodle Rockin'
videos.description: Gorky's signed to Mantra, their second single 'Poodle Rockin' was a tribute to their producer Gorwel Owen's dog Oscar. If I was a dog and had a tribute like this, I'd be pretty chuffed. Taken from their fabulous sixth album 'Spanish Dance Troupe' which was released back in 1999.

videos.title: Gorky's Zygotic Mynci - Spanish Dance Troupe
videos.description: Gorky's first single for Mantra Recordings, 'Spanish Dance Troupe' taken from the album of the same name, released in September 1999.

videos.title: Bis - Starbright Boy
videos.description: Biscuit Records needs saving, and there's only one band to save them... 'Starbright Boy' was released in October 1996 and featured on 'The New Transistor Heroes' album released 1997. Features guest appearances from Sean Rough Trade and Amelia...

videos.title: Brassy - Play Some D
videos.description: Brassy signed to Wiiija after three singles on the Costermonger label, 'Play Some D' was originally released in October 2000, and re-released in March 2003, also featuring on both Brassy's albums 'Gettin Wise' and 'Got It Made'

videos.title: Brassy - Work It Out
videos.description: The live favourite 'Work It Out' was released back in 1999 and taken from the 'Got It Made' album released on Wiiija. You work it out.

videos.title: Bis - Detour
videos.description: Co-written and featuring vocals from the legendary Lois Maffeo (who also features in the video), 'Detour' was released in 1999 and was taken from the 'Social Dancing' album.

videos.title: Bis - Everybody Thinks That They're Going To Get Theirs
videos.description: 'Everybody Thinks That They're Going To Get Theirs' comes from 'The New Transistor Heroes' album released on Wiiija back in 1996

videos.title: Bis - Action And Drama
videos.description: Released in February 1999 and taken from the 'Social Dancing' album

videos.title: The Fall - Big New Prinz
videos.description: From 1988's 'I Am Kurious Oranj'

videos.title: Swell - (I Know) The Trip
videos.description: Released as a single in February 1997 and on the 'Too Many Days Without Thinking' album of March 1997, the mighty Swell.

videos.title: Swell - Everything is Good
videos.description: Taken from the 'For All The Beautiful People' album from 1988, this is 'Everything is Good'.

videos.title: Swell - Forget About Jesus
videos.description: Taken from the excellent '41' album. There is more Swell music over here... http://psychospecificmusic.bandcamp.com/

videos.title: The Blue Aeroplanes - Broken & Mended
videos.description: 'Broken & Mended' was released back in 1994, taken from the 'Life Model' album - and was a Gerard Langley/Rodney Allen composition.

videos.title: Swell - At Long Last
videos.description: Taken from 1993's 'Room To Think' EP, released on Beggars Banquet

videos.title: The Fall - Wrong Place, Right Time
videos.description: 'Wrong Place, Right Time' from 'I Am Kurious Oranj'

videos.title: Swell - Make Up Your Mind
videos.description: 'Make Up Your Mind' was also taken from the 'For All The Beautiful People' album in 1998 - and here's the video. Oh yes.

videos.title: Voxtrot - Firecracker
videos.description: 2007's 'Firecracker' released on the 'Voxtrot' self titled album on Playlouderecordings

videos.title: The National - Abel
videos.description: Taken from 2004's 'Alligator' album on Beggars Banquet. A classic!

videos.title: The National - Bloodbuzz Ohio
videos.description: Taken from The National's 'High Violet' album, their fifth.

videos.title: Mark Lanegan (featuring PJ Harvey) - Hit The City
videos.description: 'Hit The City' features PJ Harvey on backing vocals, and is taken from Mark Lanegan's 2004 album 'Bubblegum' released on Beggars Banquet.

videos.title: McLusky - To Hell With Good Intentions
videos.description: Taken from Mclusky's second album 'Mclusky do Dallas' and released in April 2002.

videos.title: Biffy Clyro - Questions And Answers
videos.description: 'Questions and Answers' is Biffy Clyro's seventh single and the first time they got into the Top 40, entering the UK singles chart at number 26. It's taken from their second album 'The Vertigo of Bliss'. The video features singer Simon Neil in a wheelchair as he managed to break his foot the night before the video shoot. Residents of Wandsworth Town may recognise some of the streets in this video too....

videos.title: Biffy Clyro - Toys Toys Toys Choke, Toys Toys Toys
videos.description:
2002 was an incredible year for the Biffy Clyro boys. Their debut album, 'Blackened Sky', was met by a universal thumbs-up from the press. This, coupled with a hardcore touring schedule of the UK and Europe, saw them rise up the ranks and earn a fanbase bordering on a legion in the process.

This single was released on July 15th, the double A-side of 'Joy. Discovery. Invention.' & 'Toys Toys Toys Choke, Toys Toys Toys'.

videos.title: Biffy Clyro - 57
videos.description: '57' comes from Biffy's debut album 'Blackened Sky' - a re-recorded version from the early EP 'thekidswhopoptodaywillrocktomorrow' - and dates back to 2002!

videos.title: Biffy Clyro - Justboy
videos.description:
'Justboy' was biffy clyro's second single for Beggars Banquet, released on Monday the 1st of October. 

It's taken from their debut album 'Blackened Sky' which was recently reissued as an expanded edition.

videos.title: Biffy Clyro - My Recovery Injection
videos.description:
biffy clyro released the second single from 'Infinity Land' album on Monday the 20th of September 2004.

'My Recovery Injection' was written by Simon Neil/biffy clyro, produced by Chris Sheldon and recorded at Monnow Valley Studio in Monmouth. The video is directed by Bradley Beesley and Dan Brown (known for their work with Flaming Lips) in Austin, Texas.

videos.title: Biffy Clyro - Glitter and Trauma
videos.description: biffy clyro released the first single proper from their third album 'Infinity Land' on 9th August 2004. 'Glitter And Trauma' is another irresistible mix of guitar hooks and distinctive vocals courtesy of Simon Neil and the brothers Johnston, Ben and James.

videos.title: The Go-Betweens - Was There Anything I Could Do
videos.description: 'Was There Anything I Could Do' was taken from '16 Lovers Lane' back in 1988.
tags: Was There Anything I Could Do?

videos.title: The Go-Betweens - Head Full Of Steam
videos.description: From 1986 and taken from 'Liberty Belle and the Black Diamond Express' here's 'Head Full Of Steam'

videos.title: Six By Seven - Eat Junk Become Junk
videos.description:
The single "Eat Junk Become Junk" is taken from Six By Seven's classic 2000 album The Closer You Get, which is being reissued via Beggars Arkive as a double LP with extras (Peel Sessions and B-sides), along with a Greatest Hits CD via Beggars Arkive on 17 February 2017. To coincide with the releases, the band will be bringing together their original line-up for the first time in sixteen years for a triumphant return to the stage with a special show at The Maze in Nottingham on 4 March (which is now sold out) as well as a date at London’s The Garage on 11 March.

This video was made by our mate Dave Doubledrop from Nottingham. It was filmed on 16mm film around various locations in Nottingham including guitarist Sam Hempton's cellar. Dave made us eat all sorts of shit and most of us puked up. I remember not being able to eat HP Sauce for about 4 years after he got me to eat a load of it on a cold wet morning until I threw it up. - Chris Olley


New Six by Seven Kickstarter campaign - fund their new album - https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1198043864/six-by-seven-ex?ref=project_link

EAT JUNK BECOME JUNK

I’m living in my life
I’m living in my life
I saved a nation and I broke no law
I’m living in my life
I know who put me here
I saved a nation and I broke no law
So tell me something new
Yeah tell me something new
Tell me what you got to look so pleased about
Yeah tell me something new
Just tell me something new
Tell me what you got to look so pleased about

Now listen to this, now listen to this
If you eat junk you become junk
I never broke no law no
Now listen to this, now listen to this
If you eat junk you become junk
I never broke no law no, I saved a nation
I saved a nation... state of the nation

I’m living near you
I’m living in you
A shut mouth never makes no moan
I’m living in you
I’m living near you
This country’s dirty and depressing me
Nobody can beat me, nobody can beat me
I need replacing by a better man
Nobody can beat me, nobody can beat me
A better lover with a fool plan

Now listen to this, now listen to this
If you eat junk you become junk
I never broke no law no
Now listen to this, now listen to this
If you eat junk you become junk
I never broke no law no, to save a nation
I saved a nation

videos.title: Six By Seven - 88 - 92 - 96
videos.description:
Taken from 1998s 'The Things We Make'

88-92-96

This was our first video and we made it on a £2000 budget. Most of that money went on 16mm film stock and processing. It was filmed in two locations, up on the moors in Snake Pass and at Skegness or somewhere on the east coast. It was a hideous experience and to this day I have no idea why I even bothered turning up for it. Standing barefoot on the beach in winter until my feet felt like they were gonna fall off and sitting around in a freezing cold trench all day waiting for someone to fix a camera up or boss someone around was just the most thankless and idiotic way to spend a single day of your life. I could have been writing a song or watching telly, anything but that. Still I never had water thrown at my head like the other numpties. There was a girl sitting on the beach called 'catering' and she made us sandwiches with spread cheese and sand in. I wanted to kill everyone. hashtag: christianbale

People tell me Emma Niblett is in it who later made records under the name Scout Niblett. I don't really know who she is and I never met her and have no idea why she is in it?

I don't understand this video or why Chris is snogging that girl and to me it's just utter sixth form garbage that I wish I would have never taken part in. 

88-92-96

I wish you could see what I can see
I wish you could dream what I have to dream
2 million lives killed by my own hand
2 million lies have rolled across my tongue

I'm just a white singer with no tone in my voice
Things that I say, do you think i'm talking to you?
Well I don't understand this thing that I do
I still can't stand the sound of my only voice.

"But you do it so well
You do it so well
You do it so well..."

I really don't care
Stop talking at me

videos.title: Jack - Steamin'
videos.description: The wonderful Jack, taken from 1998's 'The Jazz Age' album, apparently filmed on the set of 'Get Carter', fact fans. Enjoy!

videos.title: Bettie Serveert - Tom Boy
videos.description:
Bettie Serveert are one of those rare bands who were signed to three Beggars related labels - Matador, Beggars Banquet and 4AD offshoot Guernica. Tom Boy was released on Matador and Beggars Banquet late 1992. Taken from the excellent 'Palomine' album. 

http://www.bettieserveert.com/

videos.title: Velocette - Get Yourself Together
videos.description: Velocette formed when Comet Gain split in two - and here's their wonderfully pop moment 'Get Yourself Together' taken from the 'Fourfold Remedy' album in 1997.

videos.description: Former Voodoo Queen and Mambo Taxi lady Anjali released this wonderful summery single back in 1999 on the Wiiija label. Enjoy the video!

videos.title: The Charlatans - Me. In Time
videos.description: Released in November 1991 on Situation Two, 'Me. In Time' was the first single by The Charlatans to feature Mark Collins.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Can't Get Out of Bed
videos.description: 'Can't Get Out of Bed' is taken from The Charlatans third album, 'Up To Our Hips', their first for the Beggars Banquet label. This single was released in January 1994.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Over Rising
videos.description: 'Over Rising' is The Charlatans fourth single. It reached number 15 in the UK charts, and was the last single to feature their original guitarist John Baker.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Tremelo Song
videos.description: 'Tremelo Song' was released in 1992 on the Situation Two label. It is taken from The Charlatans second album 'Between 10th and 11th'.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Then
videos.description: Taken from 1990's 'Some Friendly' album, and released as a single in September 1990, here's 'Then' from The Charlatans.

videos.title: The Charlatans - The Only One I Know
videos.description: 'The Only One I Know' was the Charlatans' debut single on Situation Two/Beggars Banquet. It reached number 9 in the UK chart and was the highest charting single from their debut album 'Some Friendly'.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Tellin' Stories
videos.description: 1997's 'Tellin' Stories' album on Beggars Banquet had four singles taken from it, and this was the last one. In fact, this was the last single The Charlatans put out via Beggars, before signing to Universal to continue releasing more indie classics.

videos.title: The Charlatans - One To Another
videos.description: 'One To Another' is a 1996 single taken from the 'Tellin' Stories' album. It was the first single to be taken from the album, and reached number 3 in the UK singles chart, The Charlatans highest ever chart position.

videos.title: The Charlatans - North Country Boy
videos.description: North Country Boy was taken from the Tellin' Stories album by The Charlatans, released in 1997. It reached number 4 in the UK singles chart.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Just Lookin'
videos.description: 'Just Lookin' is a 1995 single from The Charlatans, and is on their self-titled fourth album.

videos.title: The Charlatans - Jesus Hairdo
videos.description: Taken from the third album by The Charlatans, 'Jesus Hairdo' was a 1994 single.

videos.title: The Charlatans - How High
videos.description: 'How High' is the third single to be taken from 1997's 'Tellin' Stories' album.

videos.description: The first single released from the album 'Electric'.

videos.title: The Cult - Resurrection Joe
videos.description: A stand alone single (not originally included on any album) recorded at Hansa studios in Berlin with Chris Kimsey producing. The original release featured the title on hand drawn artwork which was mis-spelt as 'Ressurection Joe', so the song retained this title for as long as the vinyl was available.

videos.title: The Cult - Heart Of Soul
videos.description: Filmed in a derelict hotel in the countryside around Barcelona, this song was featured on the album 'Ceremony'.

videos.title: The Cult - Rain
videos.description: The second single taken from the album 'Love'

videos.title: The Cult - Edie (Ciao Baby)
videos.description: A song about the actress Edie Sedgwick. It was released as a single from the album 'Sonic Temple'.

videos.title: The Cult - She Sells Sanctuary 1993
videos.description: This was a re-mix of the rock classic done to promote the compilation album 'Pure Cult'.

videos.title: The Cult - Fire Woman
videos.description: The first single to be released from the album 'Sonic Temple'.

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Suspicion
videos.description: A single taken from the band's fourth album, 'The House Of Dolls'.

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Bruises
videos.description: An early single that was included on the debut album, 'Promise'.

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Jealous
videos.description: The lead single from the band's fifth album, 'Kiss Of Life', which was recorded after Michael Aston had left the band.

videos.title: Gene Loves Jezebel - Sweetest Thing
videos.description: A single released from the album 'Discover'.

videos.title: Gary Numan - Cars
videos.description: A game-changing song and video. Following up his UK number one hit as Tubeway Army (Are 'Friends' Electric?), Cars launched Gary Numan's solo career with another UK number one. Built around analogue synthesisers with no guitar, this was the purest form of Gary's 'Machine Music' and the track has subsequently been sampled on numerous occasions. Promotional videos were also a rarity at the time and this one created the defining image of Gary Numan.

videos.title: Freeez - Love's Gonna Get You
videos.description: The third single taken from the album 'Gonna Get you', this features John Rocca on lead vocals.

videos.title: Freeez - That Beats My Patience
videos.description: After John Rocca and Andy Stennett left the band, Peter Maas re-formed Freeez and released another album, 'Idle Vice', which featured this song as the lead single.

videos.title: Freeez - Southern Freeez
videos.description: The follow-up single to the worldwide hit I.O.U., again produced by Arthur Baker and John Robie and featured on the album 'Gonna Get you'.

videos.title: Freeez - IOU
videos.description: Freeez were a British band who had a previous UK hit with 'Southern Freeez'. Created in New York with Arthur Baker, John Robie and Jellybean Benitez (before their work with New Order) this was one of the first electro dance hits to highlight the street-scene happening in the New York boroughs. It has remained an influential track that's often sampled and all the original mixes were re-issued in 2011.

videos.title: The Cult - She Sells Sanctuary
videos.description: The rock classic, recorded at Olympic studios in Barnes and produced by Steve Brown. This was recorded and released as a stand-alone single but it was included on the band's next album, 'Love'. Though it spent months in the UK charts, and was one of the best selling tracks of the year, it actually never reached the top ten. It was the last release to feature the original Cult drummer Nigel Preston.
